questions.question: What access modifier makes members accessible only within the same class?
questions.explanation: Private members are restricted to the class where they are defined.

questions.question: What access modifier makes members accessible from anywhere?
questions.explanation: Public members can be accessed from any part of the program.

questions.question: What access modifier allows access within the class and its subclasses?
questions.explanation: Protected members are accessible in the class and its derived classes.

questions.question: What methods provide controlled access to private data?
questions.explanation: Getters and setters allow controlled reading and writing of private attributes.

questions.question: What principle bundles data and methods together?
questions.explanation: Encapsulation wraps data and methods into a single unit.

questions.question: What is the practice of hiding internal implementation details called?
questions.explanation: Information hiding restricts direct access to object internals.

questions.question: What type of method only retrieves but doesn't modify data?
questions.explanation: Getters return the value of private attributes without changing them.

questions.question: What type of method modifies private data?
questions.explanation: Setters assign new values to private attributes with validation.

questions.question: What naming convention indicates a private member in Python?
questions.explanation: Double underscore prefix triggers name mangling for privacy in Python.

questions.question: What benefit does encapsulation provide?
questions.explanation: Encapsulation protects data from unauthorized access and modification.
